metadata.title: CVE-2024-27834 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, Safari 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma14.5. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able tobypass Pointer Authentication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27834` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.44.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
